Topic.Title: Hmmmm. seems like a lousy price action

Message.Msg: Stupid fools. I am a trader. Losses? What losses. I never say short this pos. I just say may not long it. My other stocks are doing well for me. For this pos, its looking better now. Its has been rallying, and having follow throughs. Ie. Good sign. I may long it on orderly pullbacks now that I have 3 months to play it without fear of earnings surprise. Any new longs are only for trades. Only long big and hold if it corrects big to its rising 50 dma.

Topic.Title: Chart targets: 13.73 (500 DMA) and 14.67 (600 DMA)

Message.Msg: Chart confirmed 500 DMA at 13.64 remained support. Stock now knocking on the door of the biggie, the 600 DMA at 14.66. stockchartsDOTcom/c-sc/sc?s=NVDA&p=D&yr=1&mn=0&dy=0&i=t53632468076&r=1368254585116 Looking further out the Breakout target in this stock is associated with the highest Weekly MA which is currently around 350 (352-4 to be exact ) which peaks at 16.46. Notice in the chart how this had to be broken in 2011 before the sharp rise to 26 could occur. Notice also how it bound the stock ever since it fell below it later in 2011. Break 16.46 and some of you how bought in that sharp 2011 rise have a chance of getting your money back. stockchartsDOTcom/c-sc/sc?s=NVDA&p=W&yr=3&mn=0&dy=0&i=t33336188895&r=1368255379114

Topic.Title: whosun

Message.Msg: "Embarrassed?" why should I be? Tegra is doing exactly what I'd been saying since last Nov. cc - Tegra died on the vine. I called it exactly. "How do you model the Tegras?" nvda is nothing but a PC graphic company in this mobile world.

Topic.Title: whosun

Message.Msg: What's your outlook for Tegra for the second half?

Topic.Title: whosun

Message.Msg: Wall street does not like '10% customers'. Tegra, as in app processor biz, nvda is up reporting Tegra sales by lumping in 'cheap' modem sales, has a 70+% customer in Nexus 7. What will Tegra do 2nd half? ask el goog. Tegra as an app proc is not a business. no guess with nexus 7, with bias they lost it because of google's spread the wealth policy. I seriously doubt winRT will live, especially now that intel is getting x86 power consumption house in order. outside goog, T3i will probably ramp some towards end of the year. but nothing dramatic, as in top 2 names in phones will not be using nvda. bulk of 'Tegra' as reported sales will probably come from 'cheap' radios. nvda is nothing but a pc gaming graphics house.

Topic.Title: whosun

Message.Msg: What's your deal...? You are a disgusting person.. what has nvda ever done to you?

Topic.Title: Get real

Message.Msg: O - I doubt we see 12's again if so I'd back the truck up and load up. I would be happy to see a pullback to mid 13's to recover the assigned block I will lose next week and that may not be likely barring an overall correction - which we are due for. Either way the stock is worth 18 based on potential revenue and is undervalued even at current revenue - technicals aside. The only thing that could be perceived as negative is their redefinition of the Tegra TAM - apparently automotives is going to be a larger driver of revenue than I thought in lieu of say high end smart phones. I know they won the next ford/ms contract for the sync apps processor so this does appear to be the case.

Topic.Title: Only in Nvidialand is $100 to $5 a great stock!

Message.Msg: If you truly think that this thing is #$%$, get yourself a short position. I can pick points on a graph as easily as you. Lets say something like... "...To illustrate this point, Nvidia went from 8 or so to 26 in less than a few months! That's up 300%!... " It's next to meaningless blather so stop doing it. Stock price is simply about supply and demand. The underlying company and managing expectations are what matters. By the way, a few other bits of info on when Nvidia went from 8-26. They reported a horrid quarter, had massive short interest and Kramer recommended Nvidia. All things that bashes tend to pick on.

Message.Title: Adobe Creative Cloud
Message.Msg: The creative software maker announced recently that it will put all of its resources into developing and promoting its Creative Cloud. According to Adobe, since Creative cloud was launched last year, the company saw tremendous growth, and, therefore, the companyâ€™s future is in the cloud. Source: techcrunchDOTcom/2013/05/06/adobe-goes-all-in-with-subscription-based-creative-cloud-will-stop-selling-regular-cs-licenses-shrink-wrapped-boxes/ ========================================= Comments: Adobe's Creative Cloud portends insatiable needs for cloud graphics hardware, which Nvidia's GRID targets to provide.
